intro: Pseudolopezia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered pseudolopezia, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of its family. Pseudolopezia longiflora is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in specialty gardens.
